pair_steps.title: Pairing
pair_steps.subtitle: Use Tesla Fleet-API to connect your car
pair_steps.subtitle_02: Use Tesla Fleet-API to connect your energy site
pair_steps.text_01: To use this app, you need a Tesla developer account.
pair_steps.text_02: Proceed only if you want to create a developer account at tesla.com. You get Fleet API access with a monthly discount of 10$. That should cover an average usage. If you need more, you can add a subscription later.

pair_step_01.title: Tesla app registration
pair_step_01.subtitle: Create a developer account
pair_step_01.text_01: Open Tesla website and create a developer account.
pair_step_01.text_02: Then create an app. Fill in your name, insert an app name and description like 'Homey App'.
pair_step_01.text_03: You can skip the invoice step if you don't want to add a subscription and use the free 10$ first.
pair_step_01.test_04: You will get a 'Client ID' and a 'Client Secret' for next pair step.
pair_step_01.text_06: continue the process if you have a client_id and client_secret.
pair_step_01.text_12a: Profile information, Vehicle information, vehicle location, vehicle commands, vehicle charging management

pair_step_02.title: Tesla app credentials
pair_step_02.subtitle: Tesla app credentials
pair_step_02.text_01: Insert your app credentials from your Tesla developer account.
pair_step_02.text_02: You can now login to your Tesla account.

pair_step_03.title: App certificate
pair_step_03.subtitle: App certificate
pair_step_03.text_01: The app created a certificate (private and public key).
pair_step_03.text_02: This certificate is used to sign commands sent to your car. The public key is hosted on your domain and registererd as car key. The private key is used to encrypt and sign commands.
pair_step_03.text_03: Save the public key as file. Upload the file to your domain. Subdomains are allowed. The root domain must match the 'allowed origin' domain from your app registration.
pair_step_03.text_04: The file must be hosted under this name.
pair_step_03.public_key: Public key. Upload to your domain

pair_step_04.title: Register the domain
pair_step_04.subtitle: Register the domain
pair_step_04.text_01: If the public key is hosted on your domain, you can register the domain for your app.
pair_step_04.text_02:
Please ensure, the URL path is exactly like
https://[your domain]/.well-known/appspecific/com.tesla.3p.public-key.pem
pair_step_04.text_05: Tesla API returned an error response.
pair_step_04.text_06: Continue if the domain was registered successfully.

pair_step_05.title: Add your car
pair_step_05.subtitle: Login to your Tesla account.
pair_step_05.text_02: You can now login to your Tesla account.
pair_step_05.text_03: If you used a second account for your app, please clear your browser cookies for tesla.com to ensure you are using the account your car is assigned to.

register.title: App registration
register.subtitle: Register the Homey app in your car
register.text1: Register the Homey app in your car to allow the app to send commands to your car.
register.text2: Use the registration button to start registering in the Tesla app. If the link opens in the browser, then follow the 'Open in Tesla App' hint.
register.text3: This registration is necessary to use the 'Tesla Vehicle Commands Protocol' and the end-to-end encryption of commands sent to the vehicle.
register.text4: Pre-2021 models S/X are excluded. These can still be controlled via the REST API. Please select the command API in the device settings.
register.text5: This registration can be repeated via the 'Repair Device' dialog.

register_ble.title: App registration for Bluetooth LE
register_ble.subtitle: Register the Homey app in your car for Bluetooth LE
register_ble.text1: Register the Homey app in your car to allow the app to send commands to your car.
register_ble.text2: This registers the app as car key to use the Homey app via Bluetooth LE. You need this key in addition to the registered key for FleetAPI.
register_ble.text3: Sit in the car and place the NFC card on the console.
register_ble.text4: Then start the key registration process. Follow the instructions on the vehicle display.

donate.title: Your support is appreciated
donate.text1: If you find this app useful, please consider supporting ongoing development and the operation of the server infrastructure for Fleet Telemetry with a donation via PayPal Friends. Thank you!

car.trunk_not_allowed: Trunk operation disabled in device settings
car.app_not_registered: App is not registered in the car. Register via car device repair process.
car.command_error_426: App update required. Please update the app in the Homey app store or enable automatic updates.
car.api_client_id_not_set: Tesla Client ID and Client Secret not set. Please repair the device and use a personal Tesla developer account and app registration.
car.telemetry_activation_error: Error during Telemetry registration. Please check car authentication.

update.update_message: The next version of Tesla app addes a new permission (Homey location). Auto update is not working in this case. Please check for updates manually next days and install the next version from app store.

widget.car_select: Select your car in widget settings

telemetry.donation: Server infrastructure is required for Telemetry. If you like this feature, please support me with a donation (Paypal friends). See app store page or repair view for details.
